projectGridLines.title: Special Projects Intern- Business Operations
projectGridLines.description:
Description: As an Special Projects Intern at SNITCH, you will be at the forefront of our business management, responsible for implementing solutions to bring efficiency across the supply chain

Skill sets: Advanced Excel,SQL Supply Chain Management

Responsibilities:

As an Operations Intern - Special Projects at SNITCH, you will be at the forefront of our business management, responsible for:


  • End-to-End Business Management: You'll be the driving force behind planning, monitoring, and creating dashboards to establish a solid review and feedback mechanism.
  • Data-Driven Solutions: Devising data-driven action plans to quickly address escalations from field teams, warehouse,partners, and stakeholders.
  • Continuous Improvement: Monitoring and enhancing daily operations, deploying and building processes based on our business goals and key metrics.
  • Collaboration: Coordinating with the field operations team to implement operational and strategic initiatives, all while developing clear work plans.
  • System and Process Building: Ensuring that all systems in the warehouse and operations function seamlessly while aligning with our high-quality standards.
  • Compliance and Efficiency: Building processes that not only meet our business objectives but also ensure compliance with industry standards.
  • On-Ground Availability: You'll be the hands-on leader who is readily available on the ground, not hesitating to solve problems and set things up from the ground.
  • Customer-Centric: Delivering exceptional customer experiences through on-ground and remote setups.
  • Data Expertise: Utilising strong data visualisation and evaluation skills to transform data into actionable insights and recommendations.
  • SOP Implementation: Designing, documenting, and implementing Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to enhance process robustness.
  • Process Adherence: Working with operations teams to guarantee that stakeholders adhere to standardised processes, as per the process playbook.
  • Bridge Builder: Being a constant bridge between the ground operations team and other functions such as Business Development, Tech, and Finance.

Skills Required:

An in-depth understanding of specific supply chain functions, such as procurement and transportation, and the ability to communicate your expertise clearly.

  • Exposure to various supply chain functions, from procurement to retailing.
  • Proficiency in supply chain software and solutions to engage clients effectively.
  • Strategic Thinker: Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Collaborative: The ability to coordinate seamlessly with cross-functional teams.
  • Adaptability: Willingness to work in a highly ambiguous environment with a strong bias for action.
  • Initiative: The ability to develop, execute, improvise, and enhance 0-1 building and growth initiatives.
  • Pace-Setter: Thriving in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment.


Supply Chain Domain Knowledge: You should possess:


These skills are essential to succeed in this role

projectGridLines.title: Software Development Intern
projectGridLines.description:
Description: As a Software Development Intern at Snitch, you will play a pivotal role in the development of our shopping, supply chain and data engineering systems.

Skill sets: ReactJs, React Native, Node JS, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript

About The Role

As a Software Development Intern at Snitch, you will play a pivotal role in the development of our shopping, supply chain and data engineering systems. Working within a high-performance team, you will have the opportunity to leverage your expertise to architect and build innovative solutions that elevate our customer experience to new heights. This is a unique opportunity to join us at the forefront of our engineering transformation and work closely with the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) on creation of a platform that will redefine the future of online fashion retail.

What You'll Do


  • Full Stack Development: Spearhead the development efforts for our frontend and backend systems, utilizing React and React Native for frontend development and Node.js and Python for backend services.
  • Architect and Implement Microservices: Design, develop, and maintain microservices architecture to ensure scalability, flexibility, and modularity of our systems, with a focus on optimizing performance and resource utilization.
  • Ensure Code Quality and Documentation: Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
  • Ensure Security and Reliability: Implement robust security measures and best practices across all layers of the application stack, including authentication, authorization, data protection, and encryption. Continuously monitor and enhance system reliability, uptime, and fault tolerance.
  • Collaborate with Cross-functional Teams: Work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements, translate them into technical solutions, and deliver high-quality features and products that meet user needs.
  • Drive Technical Excellence: Lead by example in adopting industry standards and emerging technologies to innovate and improve our development practices.
  • Optimize Performance and Scalability: Identify bottlenecks, optimize system performance, and implement strategies for horizontal and vertical scalability to support growing business demands and user traffic.
  • Agile Development: Embrace Agile methodologies and practices, including sprint planning, backlog grooming, daily standups, and retrospective meetings. Contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and learning within the engineering team.


Who You Are


  • Strong computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, design patterns
  • Experience working on these technologies like ReactJs, React Native, Node JS, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript
  • Hands-on experience in Microservices, RESTful web services development in NodeJS
  • Experience with TDD (Test Driven Development) and writing robust Unit Test cases
  • Working knowledge of SQL/No-SQL and database technologies (MySQL, Mongo DB, Cosmos DB)
  • Knowledge of any cloud platform solutions (Azure, GCP, AWS)
  • Exposure to architecture best practices (Cloud, Microservices, Serverless)
  • Knowledge in deploying solutions on any of these cloud platforms (Azure, GCP) and containerised ecosystems (Docker, Kubernetes)
  • CI/CD Automation experience with tools like Git, Maven, Jenkins & Azure DevOps is a good to have
  • Willing to adapt and learn new/emerging technologies
  • Exceptional communication, interpersonal skills, and a team player
